item.title: See the rising sea
item.description: Responding to the global effects of climate change — whether by mitigation or adaptation — requires that we, as humans, collectively change how we live. In many ways, how we live is governed by what policies we, or whomever made those policies, decided. Perhaps an effective way in some societies to enact change for the common good is, sadly, for those in power — e.g., those wealthy — to internalize future effects. Thus, if someone demonstrates that climate change negatively affects those in power to change policies, change is more likely.
